fields.label: Kanji
fields.description: The written form of the entry as it typically appears (kanji, kana, or mixed). This field is the DISPLAY spelling, not necessarily 'kanji-only'. Examples: 悪魔, ありがとう, ドキドキ, 毒ガス.

fields.label: Reading
fields.description: The pronunciation, written in kana (usually hiragana; katakana ok for katakana words). Examples: あくま, ありがとう, どきどき / ドキドキ.

fields.label: Meaning
fields.description: English gloss/translation. Keep it short; add nuance in example notes when needed.

fields.label: Type
fields.description: Grammatical classification: how it behaves in sentences. Use `lexicalClass` to capture families like onomatopoeia or greetings that can cross POS. Rules of thumb: if it is one lexical word, pick noun/verb/adj/adverb/etc. If it is multi-word or a fixed chunk, pick expression/phrase/sentence types.

values.noun: Standalone noun (名詞). Can take particles like が/を/に. Example: 本, 勉強.
values.standalone-noun: A single kanji that can stand alone as a noun WITHOUT okurigana (rare; only when truly used alone).
values.compound-morpheme: Bound morpheme used mainly inside compounds; not typically a standalone word (e.g., 〜学, 〜性).
values.verb-stem: Kanji/root that appears as part of a verb requiring okurigana; not a full dictionary-form verb by itself (e.g., 受け in 受ける).
values.numeral: Number words / numeric forms (一, 二, ３, etc.). Use `counter` for counter words like 〜枚, 〜人.
values.ichidan-verb: 一段動詞 dictionary form (e.g., 食べる, 見る).
values.godan-verb: 五段動詞 dictionary form (e.g., 書く, 泳ぐ).
values.irregular-verb: Irregular verbs (する, 来る) and irregular verb entries.
values.i-adjective: い-adjective (い形容詞) (e.g., 高い, 忙しい).
values.na-adjective: な-adjective (な形容詞) (e.g., 便利, きれい).
values.particle: Particle / function word (e.g., は, が, を, に, で, から, まで).
values.adverb: Adverb (副詞) or adverb-like word used to modify verbs/clauses (e.g., すぐ, ゆっくり). Many mimetics belong here (ドキドキ(と)する, キラキラ(と)光る) — mark those with lexicalClass='onomatopoeia'.
values.conjunction: Connective/conjunction (接続詞) linking clauses/sentences (e.g., でも, そして).
values.counter: Counter word used with numerals (e.g., 〜人, 〜枚, 〜つ).
values.expression: Fixed conventional phrase (often multi-word) that is used as a unit (e.g., おつかれさま, しょうがない). Not a full sentence unless it clearly contains its own predicate.
values.descriptive-phrase: Descriptive multi-word phrase used as a modifier or chunk (often not fully idiomatic).
values.sentence: Full sentence with its own predicate (usually ends with a verb/です/ます etc.).
values.phrase-sentence: Clause-like chunk that forms a complete predicate unit (shorter than a full sentence record, but still predicate-bearing).

fields.label: Lexical Class
fields.description: Lexical family / usage domain (word 'kind'), independent of grammar `type`. Use this to capture important categories that cross parts of speech: onomatopoeia/mimetics, manga SFX, greetings, interjections, and set phrases. Defaults to 'regular' when none apply.

values.regular: Normal lexical item with no special family tag.
values.onomatopoeia: Sound-symbolic mimetic (擬音語・擬態語): often repeated patterns and used with と or する (e.g., ドキドキ, キラキラ, ワクワク, ベタベタ). Usually type='adverb' (or sometimes noun/na-adjective in specific uses).
values.sfx: Sound-effect token (especially manga/quotes): often standalone with ！/… and not a normal dictionary word (e.g., ドン！, ゴー！, ピッ).
values.set-phrase: Fixed conventional chunk (定型表現) learned as a unit; may not map cleanly to a single POS (e.g., しょうがない).
values.greeting: Greeting/aisatsu (挨拶): used in social exchange (e.g., こんにちは, おつかれさま).
values.interjection: Spontaneous utterance (感動詞): あっ, えっ, へえ, ええと.

fields.label: Orthography
fields.description: Indicates the script usually used to write the word. Helpful for words like 'いちご' (usually kana) or loanwords that are katakana-only.

values.kanji: Primarily written in kanji (漢字), okurigana as needed.
values.hiragana: Primarily written in kana (平仮名 or 片仮名), rarely uses its possible kanji form
values.both: Both kanji and kana are commonly used (context-dependent).
values.katakana: Primarily written in katakana (片仮名), often loanwords or mimetics.

fields.label: Verb Type
fields.description: Structural type for lexical verbs only (single dictionary-form verbs). Do NOT use for sentence-like phrases. For mimetic + する (ドキドキする), prefer type='adverb' + lexicalClass='onomatopoeia' and note 'often used with する' in example notes.

values.simple: Single lexical verb (e.g., 飲む, 生きる).
values.compound: Compound verb formed from two verbs or stem+verb.
values.suru: Suru-verb (サ変動詞) lexicalized as a verb entry (e.g., 勉強する as a verb entry, if you store it that way).
values.expression: Sentence-like phrase, not a lexical verb (rare; usually better classified as type='sentence' or 'expression').

fields.label: Compound Type
fields.description: Only if `verbType` is 'compound': describes how predictable/conventional the compound meaning is.

values.compositional: Derived by rule; meaning predictable from components.
values.grammaticalized: Second verb is auxiliary-like; original lexical meaning weakened.

fields.label: Origin
fields.description: Etymological source. Use for loanwords and katakana items where origin matters. For native mimetics written in katakana, use origin='Japanese'.

values.English: Direct loan from English with mostly equivalent meaning.
values.English-derived: Loan from English with semantic narrowing/shift in Japanese.
values.Wasei-eigo: Japanese coinage built from English elements.
values.Japanese: Native Japanese word or internal formation.
values.Other: Loanword from another language not listed.
